thoughts.text: Now that we have the process ID of the 'river_simulation.py' script, we can use the 'kill' command to terminate it. I will also add a timestamp to the output file name to distinguish between different runs of the script.
thoughts.reasoning: The 'kill' command can be used to terminate a running process based on its process ID. This will help us stop the 'river_simulation.py' script from running. Adding a timestamp to the output file name will make it easier to distinguish between different runs of the script.
thoughts.plan:
- Use 'kill' command to terminate the 'river_simulation.py' script
- Add a timestamp to the output file name
thoughts.criticism: I should have used the 'kill' command earlier to terminate the 'river_simulation.py' script. This would have prevented it from running for too long.
thoughts.speak: Now that we have the process ID of the 'river_simulation.py' script, we can use the 'kill' command to terminate it. I will also add a timestamp to the output file name to distinguish between different runs of the script.
